headline: Morning Movers: Cleveland-Cliffs rallies after second quarter earnings release
summary: Stock futures have inched higher, driven by optimism over potential U.S.-EU trade progress and the start of a busy earnings week featuring top tech names like Alphabet and Tesla. In commodities and bonds, yields eased slightly as investors embraced calming signals: Treasury yields dipped to 4.38% on the 10-year, the dollar weakened, and gold held steady amid easing tariff jitters. In pre-market trading, S&P 500 futures rose 0.19%, Nasdaq futures rose 0.18% and Dow futures rose 0.21% Check out th
